Text: Appearances of Argentine Marxist revolutionary Che Guevara (1928–1967) in popular culture are common throughout the world.
Triplets:<Che Guevara
2:
--------------------
<Text: Che Guevara in popular culture:  Che Guevara's image is viewed as everything from an inspirational icon of revolution, to a retro and vintage logo.>

Triplet: <Che Guevara
3:
--------------------
Text: Che Guevara in popular culture:  Most commonly he is represented by a facial caricature originally by Irish artist Jim Fitzpatrick and based on Alberto Korda's famous 1960 photograph titled "Guerrillero Heroico".
Triplets:<Che Guevara
5:
--------------------
Text: Che Guevara in popular culture:  For many around the world, Che has become a generic symbol of the underdog, the idealist, the iconoclast, or the martyr.
Triplets:<Che Guevara
6:
--------------------
Text: Che Guevara in popular culture:  He has become, as author Michael Casey notes in "Che's Afterlife: The Legacy of an Image", "the quintessential postmodern icon signifying anything to anyone and everything to everyone."
Triplets:<Che Guevara
